I think my house might cover the trade.  Wow.  Wish you the best in the sale.

[quote name="Pup6913" post=869886]I think my house might cover the trade.  Wow.  Wish you the best in the sale.[/QUOTE]

I don't think mine would. :o  Good luck!

May I take a guess at the asking price, for fun?  I must admit I know very little about most of these sets and prices will vary based on condition etc ...

T206 set (minus big 6, with all the back brands and color variations) - $100 each x 500 = $50,000
T207 set (minus 5) - $100 x 195 = $19,500
T209-1 complete set - $300 x 16 = $4,800
M116 near set (261 different) - $100 x 261 = $26,100
D322 set (minus dreyfuss) - $500 x 24 = $12,000
D304 set (set of 30 with all the "traded" cards and all 5 backs) - $750 x 30 = $22,500
E90-2 complete set - $500 x 11 = $5,500
E90-3 complete set - $500 x 20 = $10,000
E95 complete set - $200 x 25 = $5,000
E96 complete set - $300 x 30 = $9,000

So ballpark of $164k  GOOD LAWD!
(I'm not trying to alter anyone's asking price, as I know nothing about the conditions of the cards or their market values.  Simply trying take a stab in the dark.  Best of luck with the sale, Robert!!!)

Rob
:)
Does this mean you're leaving the vintage card game, Rob?   I certainly hope not.

Everyone has these sets completed already so demand will be low.


JK

mid-size collection compared to what??

good luck with the sale, sounds like a nice collection
